job_history.work_description: I oversee the purchasing, management, and maintenance of all infrastructure-related hardware and software, while simultaneously overseeing end-user hardware and software support for a law school with roughly 85 FTE faculty/staff, and 275 students with a roughly 1:1 PC:Mac user ratio.

Primary responsibilities included the day-to-day support of end-user hardware, software, and peripherals in a mixed Microsoft Windows, Mac OS X, linux, and Novell environment, while also assisting with the everyday demands of maintaining a rather complex campus-wide network that was driven by a predominately Cisco infrastructure.
I supported all end-user related hardware and software demands for the entire school district.
Predominately industrial electrical work, mostly in a manufacturing setting, with some residential work mixed in.

skills.name: IT Management
skills.explanation: Oversees the purchasing, management, and maintenance of all infrastructure-related hardware and software, indicating expert-level mastery.

skills.name: Technical Support
skills.explanation: Has extensive experience providing end-user hardware and software support in various environments, showing expert-level proficiency.

skills.name: Network Administration
skills.explanation: Assisted with maintaining a complex campus-wide network with a predominately Cisco infrastructure, suggesting strong proficiency.

skills.name: Hardware Maintenance
skills.explanation: Supported all end-user related hardware demands for an entire school district, indicating strong proficiency.

skills.name: Software Management
skills.explanation: Oversees the management of software in a mixed environment, suggesting strong proficiency.

skills.name: Leadership
skills.explanation: Has experience in administrative roles, but not as a primary focus, indicating a solid working proficiency.

skills.name: Electrical Work
skills.explanation: Predominately industrial electrical work experience, but not directly related to current role, suggesting some practical experience.

skills.name: Microsoft Windows
skills.explanation: Supported end-user hardware and software in a mixed environment, including Microsoft Windows, suggesting strong proficiency.

skills.name: Mac OS X
skills.explanation: Supported end-user hardware and software in a mixed environment, including Mac OS X, suggesting strong proficiency.

skills.name: Linux
skills.explanation: Assisted with maintaining a complex campus-wide network with a predominately Cisco infrastructure, including Linux, suggesting solid working proficiency.

skills.name: Cisco Infrastructure
skills.explanation: Assisted with maintaining a complex campus-wide network with a predominately Cisco infrastructure, suggesting strong proficiency.
